She's able to open her eyes and understand and show people she understands what she's hearing and seeing. Gabrielle Giffords began breathing without a ventilator yesterday as doctors took out the breathing tube that had run down her throat and replaced it with a tracheotomy tube in her windpipe. Surgeons also inserted a feeding tube.
